greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(3*k-2) = a(k), a(3*k-1) = a(k), a(3*k) = 1 for k >= 1, starting with a(1) = 0.
comment: Together with A189816, this sequence completes the list of "type 3,3" sequences described at A189628.
Alternate definition: a(n) = 1 if the ternary representation of n-1 has at least one "2" in it. Otherwise, a(n) = 0. Partial sums are given by A081610. - _Nathaniel Johnston_, May 17 2011
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..13122
program: (Scheme) (define (A189820 n) (cond ((= 1 n) 0) ((zero? (modulo n 3)) 1) (else (A189820 (+ 1 (/ (- n (modulo n 3)) 3)))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 18 2017
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 28 2011
ext: Typo in definition fixed by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 11 2011
